page.title: 08HILL FARMING
page.content: Most of the land in our area is hilly and lies about 1000 feet above sea level. As a result,no arable farming is possible,and the only crop is grass.The average size of the farms in our area is about 100 acres. Pastoral farming concentrates on sheep and cattle.The cows mainly used are Friesian and the sheep are Gritstone and Cheviot. Most cows are kept in small herds of between 30 and 100 animals,and much of the milk they produce is farm-bottled and sold locally as unpasteurised milk. Some of the rough grazing on the high moor has been taken over by the Army for use as a firing range,and some of the original farmhouses on the lower slopes have now been converted to ordinary homes.
